numSensor.label: Number of Bad External Battery Packs
Parallel System Output Apparent Power - Phase .1.3.6.1.4.1.318.1.1.1.14.8.1.2
Parallel System Total Output Apparent Power
Minimum Number of UPS to Power the Load

description.activeText: On battery power in response to an input power problem.
description.inactiveText: No longer on battery power.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the UPS is connected to its power source correctly, and that source is providing the proper power.

description.activeText: The battery power is too low to continue to support the load; the UPS will shut down if input power does not return to normal soon.
description.inactiveText: A low battery condition no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: The UPS cannot continue to use its battery power to support its load equipment. The remaining runtime equals, or is less than, the runtime defined by its "Low Battery" setting. Consider upgrading to a UPS that provides more runtime.

description.activeText: At least one faulty battery exists.
description.inactiveText: A faulty battery no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Replace all faulty batteries.

description.activeText: Lost the local network management interface-to-UPS communication.
description.inactiveText: Restored the local network management interface-to-UPS communication.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the UPS and its agent are connected to each other properly, and that normal power is available to both.

description.activeText: AVR (Automatic Voltage Regulator) Boost is active.
description.inactiveText: AVR (Automatic Voltage Regulator) Boost is no longer active.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: No action required.

description.activeText: AVR (Automatic Voltage Regulator) Trim is active.
description.inactiveText: AVR (Automatic Voltage Regulator) Trim is no longer active.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: No action required.

description.activeText: The load exceeds 100% of rated capacity.
description.inactiveText: The load no longer exceeds 100% of rated capactity.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Reduce the load on the UPS to a safe level (less than 100%) or upgrade to a unit that can support the existing load.

description.activeText: The battery power is too low to support the load; if power fails, the UPS will be shut down immediately.
description.inactiveText: A discharged battery condition no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: This condition typically exists following a runtime calibration, or when the UPS returns to online operation following a prolonged power failure. In both cases, monitoring the UPS should show that battery power is recharging.

description.activeText: In bypass in response to the bypass switch at the UPS, typically for maintenance.
description.inactiveText: No longer in bypass.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: The switch at the UPS was used to put the UPS into bypass mode, typically for maintenance. Since the UPS cannot support its load if a power failure occurs, return the UPS to online operation as soon as possible.

description.activeText: In bypass in response to the UPS front-panel or a user-initiated software command, typically for maintenance.
description.inactiveText: No longer in bypass.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: A user-initiated command from a management application or UPS accessory put the UPS into bypass mode, typically for maintenance. Since the UPS cannot support its load if a power failure occurs, return the UPS to online operation as soon as possible.

description.activeText: In bypass in response to an internal hardware fault.
description.inactiveText: No longer in bypass.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure is preventing the UPS from supporting its load if a power failure occurs.

description.activeText: A bypass power supply fault exists.
description.inactiveText: A bypass power supply fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: A base module fan fault exists.
description.inactiveText: A base module fan fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: Sleeping on a timer.
description.inactiveText: No longer sleeping on a timer.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: No action required.

name.inactiveText: No Longer Sleeping Until Utility Power Returns

description.activeText: Sleeping until utility power returns.
description.inactiveText: No longer sleeping until utility power returns.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the UPS is connected to its power source correctly, and that source is providing the proper power.

description.activeText: The output power is turned off.
description.inactiveText: The output power is now turned on.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: When the load equipment is ready to use the output power from the UPS, turn on the UPS.

description.activeText: Lost communication with the battery packs.
description.inactiveText: Restored communication with the battery packs.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the battery packs are connected correctly.

description.activeText: A graceful shutdown process is being used to shut down the load equipment before the UPS turns off.
description.inactiveText: A graceful shutdown process has completed.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Save and close any files at any device that receives power from the UPS. The UPS will turn off as soon as the time defined by a shutdown delay at that UPS expires.

description.activeText: A fault has occured with the Smart Boost/Trim for the UPS.
description.inactiveText: The Smart Boost/Trim has been restored.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support)

description.activeText: The output voltage is outside its defined limits.
description.inactiveText: The output voltage is no longer outside its defined limits.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support)

description.activeText: A battery charger fault exists.
description.inactiveText: A battery charger fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support)

description.activeText: The internal battery temperature exceeds the critical threshold.
description.inactiveText: The internal battery temperature no longer exceeds the critical threshold.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the cooling solutions for the battery environment, and the central air conditioning system, are functioning properly.

description.activeText: The battery is not installed properly.
description.inactiveText: The battery is now installed.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure a battery is properly installed at the UPS.

description.activeText: System level fan fault exists.
description.inactiveText: System level fan fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: A site wiring fault has been detected.
description.inactiveText: A site wiring fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Have a licensed electrician ensure that the proper input wiring is connected to the UPS. This includes the proper phase rotation, a proper neutral connection, a proper ground connection, and a proper grounding electrode conductor connection.

description.activeText: A power module fault exists.
description.inactiveText: A power module fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Replace all faulty modules.

description.activeText: A main intelligence module fault exists.
description.inactiveText: A main intelligence module fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: A redundant intelligence module fault exists.
description.inactiveText: A redundant intelligence module fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: A battery fault exists.
description.inactiveText: A battery fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Replace all faulty batteries.

description.activeText: A load (kVA) alarm threshold violation exists.
description.inactiveText: A load (kVA) alarm threshold violation no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the threshold is set correctly at the UPS. Reduce the load to a safe level (less than 100%), or upgrade to a unit that can support the existing load

description.activeText: Lost power module redundancy.
description.inactiveText: Restored power module redundancy.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: The UPS can no longer detect any redundant power modules. Correct any power module problems (removed or failed), add power modules, or reduce the load.

description.activeText: A redundancy alarm threshold violation exists.
description.inactiveText: A redundancy alarm threshold violation no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the threshold is set correctly at the UPS. Add power modules, or reduce the load, if necessary.

name.activeText: Input Voltage Or Frequency Cannot Support Bypass
name.inactiveText: Input Voltage And Frequency Can Now Support Bypass

description.activeText: An input voltage or frequency problem prevents switching to bypass mode.
description.inactiveText: An input voltage or frequency problem no longer prevents switching to bypass mode.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Correct the input power problem, if possible, or wait for the input power problem to clear. Note: Some UPS systems have settings that allow the UPS to switch to bypass if this status exists when a hardware failure occurs. In such cases, correct the power problem, or shut down the equipment powered by the UPS.

name.activeText: Bypass Relay Stuck In Bypass Mode

description.activeText: The bypass relay is stuck in its bypass position.
description.inactiveText: The bypass relay is no longer stuck in its bypass position.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

name.activeText: Bypass Relay Stuck In Online Mode

description.activeText: The bypass relay is stuck in its online position.
description.inactiveText: The bypass relay is no longer stuck in its online position.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: In bypass in response to an internal hardware fault.
description.inactiveText: No longer in bypass.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure is preventing the UPS from supporting its load if a power failure occurs. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: In bypass in response to an overload.
description.inactiveText: No longer in bypass.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Reduce the load on the UPS to a safe level (less than 100%) or upgrade to a unit that can support the existing load.

description.activeText: In bypass for maintenance.
description.inactiveText: No longer in bypass.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: The switch at the UPS was used to put the UPS into bypass mode, typically for maintenance. Since the UPS cannot support its load if a power failure occurs, return the UPS to online operation as soon as possible.

description.activeText: The input circuit breaker is open.
description.inactiveText: The input circuit break is no longer open.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Close the circuit breaker.

description.activeText: System level fan fault exists.
description.inactiveText: System level fan fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

name.inactiveText: Main Intelligence Module Now In Control

description.activeText: The redundant intelligence module is in control.
description.inactiveText: The main intelligence module is now in control.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Correct the main intelligence module problem (it was removed or failed) that switched control to the redundant intelligence module.

description.activeText: An IIC bus communication fault exists.
description.inactiveText: An IIC bus communication fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: No power modules detected as installed.
description.inactiveText: Power modules are now detected.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the power modules are installed and connected securely.

name.activeText: Shut Down Due To Power Problem While In Bypass
name.inactiveText: Power Problem That Caused A Shutdown While In Bypass Cleared

description.activeText: An input voltage or frequency problem occured while in bypass, turning off the UPS.
description.inactiveText: The problem that caused the UPS to turn off while in bypass no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: The "Drop Load" value is selected for the "If UPS fails, and frequency or voltage is out of range" option at the UPS, and a frequency or voltage deviation occurred while in bypass. The UPS front panel display can be used to turn on the output power when the input power is corrected.

description.activeText: A runtime alarm threshold violation exists.
description.inactiveText: A runtime alarm threshold violation no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the threshold is set correctly at the device. Reduce the load to conserve as much of the remaining runtime as needed to support critical systems. Consider adding additional batteries or upgrading to a UPS that provides more runtime.

name.inactiveText: Extended Run Frame Fault Cleared Cleared

description.activeText: An extended run frame fault exists.
description.inactiveText: An extended run frame fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the frame is connected properly to the UPS.

description.activeText: The output voltage is outside its defined limits.
description.inactiveText: The output voltage is no longer outside its defined limits.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support)

description.activeText: A phase synchronization fault exists.
description.inactiveText: A phase synchronization fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: The battery is not installed properly.
description.inactiveText: The battery is now installed.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure a battery is properly installed at the UPS.

description.activeText: The battery voltage exceeds the Nominal Battery Voltage rating.
description.inactiveText: The battery voltage no longer exceeds the Nominal Battery Voltage rating.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the UPS is connected to its power source correctly, and that source is providing the proper power.

name.activeText: Non-specific Fault: Access UPS keyboard for details

description.activeText: A non-specific fault has occurred. Access the UPS keyboard for details.
description.inactiveText: The non-specific fault has cleared.

description.activeText: A site wiring fault has been detected.
description.inactiveText: A site wiring fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Have a licensed electrician ensure that the proper input wiring is connected to the UPS. This includes the proper phase rotation, a proper neutral connection, a proper ground connection, and a proper grounding electrode conductor connection.

description.activeText: The backfeed relay is open.
description.inactiveText: The backfeed relay is no longer open.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

stateSensor.label: Service Period on Wearing Parts Expired

description.activeText: The external switch gear has failed.
description.inactiveText: The external switch gear failure has cleared.

description.activeText: The external DC disconnect switch is open.
description.inactiveText: The external DC disconnect switch is no longer open.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Close the switch.

name.inactiveText: System Power Supply Card Fault Cleared

description.inactiveText: A system power supply card fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: An internal hardware failure exists. Contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.inactiveText: A battery monitor card fault no longer exists.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Remove and reinsert the card to make sure it is installed securely. If the problem persists, replace the card or contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

description.activeText: A battery monitor card was removed.
description.inactiveText: A battery monitor card was inserted.

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Remove and reinsert the card to make sure it is installed securely. If the problem persists, replace the card or contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).

alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Remove and reinsert the card to make sure it is installed securely. If the problem persists, replace the card or contact APC Support (http://www.apc.com/go/direct/index.cfm?tag=support).
